LEARN ğŸ’¡


What Should I Focus My Time On?

Tim Ferriss, an entrepreneur and business adviser who is behind www.fourhourworkweek.com,recommends two tactics for helping you to decide where to focus your time to get maximum gains. He argues that a lot of work can be saved by focusing on jobs that will have the biggest knock-on effects.

These are the two principles he recommends when choosing your next task.

Go for the â€˜Lead Dominoâ€™

In his podcast, â€˜How to Build a Large Audience from Scratch (and More)â€™, Ferriss argues that you should put your effort into the one job which, when done, will render the largest number of other jobs either easier or irrelevant. In other words, the job that has the largest number of positive knock-on effects.

When youâ€™ve got a list of things to do, use this principle to guide where you put your effort. It will stop you (as Professor Randy Pausch puts it) â€˜polishing the underside of the banisterâ€™ â€“ in other words, spending time doing jobs that arenâ€™t necessary.

Final Thoughts

Block out some time and do your most uncomfortable task. If you canâ€™t bear the thought of starting it, use the Ten Minute Rule to get you going!
